title: Watch Angelina Jolie and her children snack on a TARANTULA during trip to Cambodia
text:
Showbiz Watch Angelina Jolie and her children snack on a TARANTULA during trip to Cambodia In the eye-opening interview with the BBC, the actress also broke silence on her split from Brad Pitt Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Angelina Jolie eats tarantulas in Cambodia Share this video   Thank you for subscribing!   
Most people like to get a taste of some of the culture when they go to a new country, but Angelina Jolie has taken that one step further. 
The actress, who broke up with Brad Pitt last year, recently opened up in a revealing interview with the BBC. 
Shot in Cambodia, Angelina decided to take a break from talking about her personal life and tuck into some local cuisine. 
Instead of a bacon sandwich or a slice of pizza, the actress decided to indulge herself with some creepy crawlies. Angelina was happy to give it a try (Photo: BBC) She ripped out the creatures fangs first (Photo: BBC) 
Taking a cooking lesson from a local, Angelina and her kids tucked into a fried Tarantula in a seriously eye-watering clip. 
"Do you want to share some spider with me?" she asked her son, Maddox, before taking a bit of the poisonous bug. 
We think we'll stick with chips, hun. 'It tastes like stale chips' (Photo: BBC) 
Elsewhere in the heartbreaking interview, the star choked back the tears as she broke her silence on her divorce from Brad Pitt for the first time. 
The actress, speaking about the painful split for the first time, said she and ex-husband Pitt will "always be a family". Angelina and Brad have separated (Photo: AFP) 
Speaking to BBC World News , she said: "I don’t want to say very much about that, except to say it was a very difficult time and we are a family and we will always be a family, and we will get through this time and hopefully be a stronger family for it... 
"Many, many people find themselves in this situation. My whole family, we’ve all being through a difficult time. My focus is my children, our children... and my focus is finding this way through. Like us on Facebook
